summary: Email from Jenna Dabbs of Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP to an unknown recipient, sent the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death. The email expresses sadness at the news, inquires about the continuation of the SDNY's investigation, and offers professional support and praise for the handling of the case.

persons.name: Jenna Dabbs
persons.context: Author of the email, expressing condolences regarding Epstein's death and inquiring about the continuation of the SDNY investigation. She is an attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Epstein Case
events.description: Jenna Dabbs sends an email expressing sadness over Epstein's death and inquiring about the future of the SDNY investigation, potential civil forfeiture, or other criminal prosecutions.

locations: Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York 10118
keyFacts: The email was sent on August 10, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
The sender, attorney Jenna Dabbs, inquires whether the SDNY's investigation or case will continue, mentioning potential civil forfeiture proceedings or criminal prosecutions against other defendants.

Dabbs offers professional support, noting she has had the experience of a defendant she charged committing suicide, and praises the handling of the case as 'professional, compassionate and impressive.'
